intro: Platystemon californicus var. nutans, commonly known as the California fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive, flattened shape that resembles a fiddle. The leaves are finely divided and often have a pungent scent, which is a common trait among plants in its family.
